intro: Tricycla spinosa var. parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered spiny tricycla, is a species of flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its spiny stems and small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or white. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. This variant is noted for its hardy nature and ability to thrive in a variety of soil conditions.
